Class SampleApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • SampleApp

  • public class SampleApp
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SampleApp()
      This application makes sample API calls to the CHPL API: - shows how to make API calls using org.apache.http - shows how to parse the JSON response using com.google.gson.jsonparser

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void displayInstructions()
      Displays instructions on how to use the CHPL Sample Application
      void getSearchOptions_usesAuthentication(java.lang.String token)
      Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /data/search_options API call.
      void getSearchResult_saveResultsInFile()
      Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /search?searchTerm= API call and save as a csv
      java.lang.String getSearchResult()
      Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response as a string from the /search?searchTerm= API call
      java.lang.String getToken()
      Uses HTTP POST to call /auth/authenticate and get an authenticated token to be passed for future API calls that require an authenticated user.
      java.lang.Integer getValidUserInput()
      Returns a valid integer from the console
      java.util.Properties loadProperties(java.lang.String filePathAndName)
      Utility method to load Properties from environment.properties file.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Uses HTTP POST to call /auth/authenticate and get an authenticated token to be passed for future API calls that require an authenticated user. Uses the Properties from environment.properties to obtain username, password, and API-key Parses json response and returns the value of the token from the json
        Returns:
        String with the token
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for REST HTTP POST

      • getSearchResult

        public java.lang.String getSearchResult()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response as a string from the /search?searchTerm= API call
        Returns:
        String with the searchResult
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for REST HTTP GET

      • getSearchResult_saveResultsInFile

        public void getSearchResult_saveResultsInFile()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /search?searchTerm= API call and save as a csv
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for REST HTTP GET

      • getSearchOptions_usesAuthentication

        public void getSearchOptions_usesAuthentication(java.lang.String token)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /data/search_options API call. Uses token for authentication
        Parameters:
        token - for use in API authentication calls
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for REST HTTP GET

      • loadProperties

        public java.util.Properties loadProperties(java.lang.String filePathAndName)
        Utility method to load Properties from environment.properties file.
        Parameters:
        filePathAndName - location of environment.properties file
        Returns:
        Properties necessary for user credentials, API-key and API calls
